Package eu.iv4xr.ux.pxtesting.ltl

Class Area

java.lang.Object
eu.iv4xr.ux.pxtesting.ltl.Area
Direct Known Subclasses:
Area.CompositeArea, Area.RectangleArea
public abstract class Area extends Object
An "area" represents some 3D-space. It can be a "surface", but generally it is a space. More precisely, it is defined as a set of disjoint voxels. Typically, these voxels are of the same size, and their positions are all defined with respect to the same world-origin (by default (0,0,0)).

Two main methods are provided: contains(Vec3) checks if a location p is within the area, and covered(List) returns the list of voxels in the area that are "visited" by the list of locations ps.

The primitive-form of areas is a Rectangle. Two areas can combined using union, intersect, and substract operators. The requirement is that the composed areas are made of voxels of the same size and have the same world-origin.

NOTE: the implementation of Areas physically creates the set of voxels; so they are NOT suitable for representing huge areas.

Author:
Wish

  • Field Details

    • origin

      public eu.iv4xr.framework.spatial.Vec3 origin
      The location of the world's origin, which will be used to calculate the voxels. The default is the (0,0,0) location.

    • voxelSize

      public float voxelSize
      The assumed voxel-size. The default is 1.

    • voxels

      public HashSet<nl.uu.cs.aplib.utils.Pair<eu.iv4xr.framework.spatial.Vec3,​eu.iv4xr.framework.spatial.Vec3>> voxels
      The set of voxels of this area. Each represented by a pair (a,b) where a is the bottom coordinate of the voxel, and b is its top coordinate. "Bottom" means the corner of the voxel with the lowest (x,y,z), and top is the opposite.

    • contains

      public abstract boolean contains​(eu.iv4xr.framework.spatial.Vec3 location)
      Check if the given location is inside this area.

    • inVoxel

      static boolean inVoxel​(eu.iv4xr.framework.spatial.Vec3 p, eu.iv4xr.framework.spatial.Vec3 vxBottom, eu.iv4xr.framework.spatial.Vec3 vxTop)

    • covered

      public Set<nl.uu.cs.aplib.utils.Pair<eu.iv4xr.framework.spatial.Vec3,​eu.iv4xr.framework.spatial.Vec3>> covered​(List<eu.iv4xr.framework.spatial.Vec3> visits)
      Return the set of voxels in this area that are visited by the given list of locations. Each voxel is represented by a pair (a,b) where a is the bottom coordinate of the voxel, and b is its top coordinate. "Bottom" means the corner of the voxel with the lowest (x,y,z), and top is the opposite.

    • coveredPortion

      public float coveredPortion​(List<eu.iv4xr.framework.spatial.Vec3> visits)
      Return the proportion of the number of voxels visited by the given list of locations, with repect to the total number of voxels in this area. See also covered(List).

      Construct a rectangle-area, with the given bottom and top corners.
